Biden says he might quit presidential race if 'medical condition' emerged
item.description: Sentiment: -0.033333333333333326 Biden, 81, has come under increasing pressure from members of his own party to withdraw from the race following his disastrous debate with Trump, 78.

item.title: Ethereum co-founder warns against voting only on 'pro-crypto,' a day after a16z founders support Trump
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 Ethereum co-creator Vitalik Buterin cautioned against voting for political candidates based solely on whether they have adopted a "pro-crypto" stance.

item.title: Op-ed: How well can AI chatbots mimic doctors in a treatment setting? We put 5 to the test
item.description: Sentiment: 0.19613095238095238 We subjected five major large language models to parts of the U.S. Medical Licensing Examination Step 3 examination, widely regarded as the most challenging.

item.title: United Airlines profit jumps 23%, but third-quarter forecast disappoints amid industry overcapacity
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 United and Delta have benefited from an increase in consumers' shift to premium cabins.

item.title: Volvo Cars jumps 11% after reporting a record core operating profit
item.description: Sentiment: 0.15833333333333333 Shares of Volvo Cars rose sharply on Thursday after the company reported a jump in annual operating profit for the second quarter.

item.title: Darden Restaurants to acquire Chuy's for approximately $605 million
item.description: Sentiment: 0.5 Darden agreed to acquire all outstanding shares of Chuy's at $37.50 per share, according to a press release.

item.title: More teens are working. Here's why a job is 'becoming more compelling' for them, economist says
item.description: Sentiment: 0.10833333333333334 Last month's jobs report showed the highest teen employment rate in June since 2007. A strong economy could help teen employment continue to rise.

item.title: Some renters may be ‘mortgage-ready’ and not know it. Here's how to tell
item.description: Sentiment: -0.1 Roughly 7.9 million households in the U.S. were considered "income mortgage-ready" in 2022, Zillow found in an analysis. Here are two things to you should know.

item.title: Chaos at Copa America raises doubts over U.S. 2026 World Cup readiness
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 The U.S. is set to host 78 out of the 104 World Cup matches as a co-host of the tournament in 2026, alongside Canada and Mexico.

item.title: Why Olympic gold medalist Gabby Douglas embraces failure: 'It drove me to push the best out of myself'
item.description: Sentiment: -0.05 Douglas says her competitive slip-ups only pushed her to try harder.

item.title: TSMC second-quarter profit beats expectations as AI chip boom continues
item.description: Sentiment: 0.2 TSMC on Thursday beat revenue and profit expectations in the second quarter, as demand for advanced chips used in AI applications continue to surge.

item.title: Education Department to forgive $1.2 billion in student debt for 35,000 borrowers
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 The Biden administration announced it will cancel $1.2 billion in student debt for 35,000 workers.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: How will India spend its billions?
item.description: Sentiment: 0.182 There are high expectations for a "populist" budget since the recent general election results delivered a slimmer than expected win for Modi.

item.title: Citadel's Ken Griffin buys a stegosaurus for $45 million in a record auction sale
item.description: Sentiment: 0.1 Ken Griffin purchased a late Jurassic stegosaurus skeleton for $44.6 million at Sotheby's on Wednesday, marking the most valuable fossil ever sold at auction.

item.title: We're buying more of this chipmaker that's been overly punished in the tech sell-off
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 The purchase will increase the stock's weighting in our portfolio to 1.63%.

item.title: Inside evolving FIFA 2026 World Cup plan to cash in on the rise of high-end sports tourism
item.description: Sentiment: 0.26666666666666666 The 2026 World Cup is expected to be one of the most in-demand sports tickets of all-time, and there will be plenty of high-end hospitality packages available.

item.title: Why outlets are lagging behind other mall categories in the U.S.
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 The pandemic and the rise of e-commerce giants like Amazon and Shein have severely affected the industry.

item.title: ‘Loophole’ may get you a $7,500 tax credit for leasing an EV, auto analysts say
item.description: Sentiment: -0.015151515151515152 A tax credit for leased electric vehicles is subject to laxer rules than those that apply to purchases of new EVs.

item.title: JD Vance blames U.S. wage losses on China's efforts to build its middle class
item.description: Sentiment: 0.023674242424242417 U.S. presidential hopeful Donald Trump's new running mate JD Vance stuck to a hard line on China in his first speech since being selected earlier in the week.

item.title: The election could have a 'massive impact' on the municipal bond market, analyst says
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 The election outcome and future policy could impact the municipal bond market. Here's what muni bond investors need to know.

item.title: These 10 U.S. states have America’s best economies in 2024
item.description: Sentiment: 0.25 Business and job growth, as well as healthy balance sheets, make these ten states America's strongest economies.

item.title: These 10 U.S. states have America’s worst economies in 2024
item.description: Sentiment: -0.3499999999999999 Health of U.S. state economies measures fiscal reserves, pension obligations, credit ratings, housing and corporate growth. These 10 states are in bad shape.

item.title: SEC sues Trump Media SPAC ex-CEO Patrick Orlando for alleged fraud
item.description: Sentiment: -0.12222222222222223 Trump Media and Digital World merged in March, allowing the company behind the Truth Social platform to trade on the Nasdaq under the stock ticker DJT.

item.title: Amazon Prime Day drives U.S. online sales to record $14.2 billion
item.description: Sentiment: 0.5 Consumer electronics and back-to-school products were among the top categories.

item.title: OpenAI debuts mini version of its most powerful model yet
item.description: Sentiment: 0.1590909090909091 OpenAI on Thursday launched a new AI model, "GPT-4o mini," the artificial intelligence startup's latest effort to expand use of its popular chatbot.

item.title: Penn lays off about 100 employees as it focuses on ESPN Bet growth
item.description: Sentiment: -0.2 Investors are impatient for Penn to demonstrate its muscle with the rebranded sportsbook — a $2 billion partnership with Disney's ESPN.

item.title: Netflix reports earnings after the bell. Here's what to expect
item.description: Sentiment: 0.25 Streaming giant Netflix reports earnings after the bell, and Wall Street is keen to hear more about its ad-supported tier.

item.title: Bye-bye bitcoin, hello AI: Texas miners leave crypto for next new wave
item.description: Sentiment: 0.13636363636363635 In the race to power AI, bitcoin miners are teaming up with energy infrastructure companies in search of new ways to generate returns on their hefty investments.

item.title: Ford to spend $3 billion to expand large truck production to a plant previously set for EVs
item.description: Sentiment: 0.23484848484848483 The new plans include investing about $3 billion to expand Super Duty production, including $2.3 billion at the Canadian plant, Ford said Thursday.

item.title: Can Boeing get back to its glory days?
item.description: Sentiment: 0.0 Boeing's leaders say they have charted a path forward to fix the company. They still have plenty of people to convince.

Trading Strategy Summary
item.description: Rob Smith's "The Strat" Summary: - Price Action: Focus on pure price movements and candlestick patterns. - Time-Frame Continuity: Align trades across multiple time frames for consistency. - Market Structure: Analyze market context, support, and resistance levels. - Actionable Signals: Use specific candlestick patterns (inside bars, outside bars, continuations) for trade entries. - Broadening Formations: Recognize patterns with higher highs and lower lows to identify volatility and reversals. - Risk Management: Implement strict rules for stop losses and position sizing to preserve capital.
